alert.note: Alert for Pike (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 8:14PM CST until January 26 at 6:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in New Orleans LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tangipahoa River At Osyka affecting Pike County. For the Tangipahoa River...including Osyka, Robert...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tangipahoa River at Osyka. * WHEN...From late Thursday night to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Pastures and woodlands along with some crop land near the river will be inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.0 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.0 feet on 10/04/2002. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 215 PM CST.
